text:
Today, I asked Dr. Geeta Rao Gupta, nominee to be Ambassador-At-Large for Global Women’s Issues, about the challenges we face in promoting women’s empowerment around the world. 

She is eminently qualified, & I look forward to seeing her confirmed for this critical role. https://t.co/wmckaRzoKl

Supply chain issues continue to exacerbate inflation & hinder our recovery from the pandemic. This bipartisan bill which I supported – now law – is a critical step to ease bottlenecks & help small businesses & families stay afloat.
I'll continue working to maintain this bipartisan momentum to protect our families & ensure our water supplies are free from contamination. https://t.co/wr1g7EkWrC

Too many NH families have faced toxic PFAS exposure – that's why I prioritized this issue in the SASC-approved NDAA by: 

• Securing $20M for the PFAS health study I established 

• Banning PFAS-laden gear for DOD firefighters 

• Strengthening testing disclosure requirements

This Executive Order from @POTUS sends a powerful message of support to LGBTQ+ kids & communities across the country. 

It’s time for the Senate to follow suit and pass the Equality Act to protect LGBTQ+ people from discrimination.

And that’s just a snapshot of the priorities I helped secure for NH. I appreciate the bipartisan commitment to pass this important defense package & look forward to a full vote on the Senate floor. More details here: https://t.co/UvyktNt3Kw

• 4.6% pay raise for service members

• $30M for Anomalous Health Incidents-related care and investigation

• $800M military assistance for Ukraine

• Support for the Baltic States & Black Sea region’s security amid Putin’s war

NEW: @SASCDems just approved the FY23 NDAA. 
Here’s what I fought to include 🧵:

• $503M for the Multi-Mission Dry Dock project at Portsmouth Naval Shipyard

• $20M to continue the PFAS health study I established

• $ for NH’s submarine & night vision industrial bases

From fighting on the frontlines to administering humanitarian aid – Ukrainian women are putting their lives on the line to defend their freedom. 

This powerful read gets to the heart of why I’m leading a resolution in the Senate recognizing their heroism.

Veterans face enough challenges in the line of duty – they shouldn’t have to fight for the care they need to heal & recover when they come home.

Proud to support this historic, bipartisan effort & I urge the House to swiftly finalize so we can deliver this bill to @POTUS ASAP.

Deeply saddened to learn of the passing of State Rep. Mary Griffin, who served Windham with distinction for 25 years. I appreciated our decades of work together and was always glad to join her community TV show. She was a bedrock of the community, and she will be dearly missed.

As Ukraine holds the line against Russia’s unprovoked invasion, the U.S. remains committed to supporting our partners.

Putin’s war is not just against Ukraine – it is against democracy around the world, which is why the U.S. & global community will continue to stand by Ukraine.

Accessibility to safe abortions is under attack by extreme partisan Republicans, which is why this expansion of care is very welcomed news. 

Glad to see steps being taken to expand telehealth abortion services for Granite Staters. https://t.co/PRZAxHsMez

The U.S. stands with Alexey Navalny & all those in Russia fighting Putin’s tyrannical rule. 

Putin’s abuse of Navalny & unjust detainment and inhumane treatment of political prisoners must end. The global community is watching & will keep pressing for their release.

Vaccines save lives & are the most effective way to end the pandemic. I’m encouraged the FDA voted to expand the emergency use authorization of the COVID vaccine for kids ages 6 to 17, increasing the pool of those vaccinated against this deadly virus.

This year alone, there have been at least 27 shootings in K-12 schools - 27.  

This doesn’t happen in any of our near-peer nations.

Congress has a responsibility to #ProtectOurKids from gun violence. We have a framework to pass commonsense gun safety legislation, let's do it.

NATO expansion to Finland & Sweden makes clear to Putin that the global community will not allow him veto power over NATO membership.

To reaffirm U.S. bipartisan support for their accession, our bipartisan delegation will visit Finland & Sweden ahead of the upcoming NATO summit.
And that’s only the beginning – this is $1B of $10B in record-level funding that I worked to include in the bipartisan infrastructure law. More: https://t.co/CGJ35SETWB

When I was writing the water provisions in the bipartisan infrastructure bill, I envisioned moments like this: tangible results that will make a real difference in our communities. Thrilled to share $1B is available for NH & states to apply for $$ to address PFAS contamination.

As COVID cases rise, the impact of the prolonged pandemic on NH’s public health services without additional relief available is clear. We can’t afford to be caught flatfooted w/another surge. Rs must end their obstruction to additional COVID aid now. 

https://t.co/85ZTBKLXL7

10 years ago, the DACA program launched, changing the lives of hundreds of thousands who were brought to the US as kids, providing them protection to remain in the only place many have ever called home.

Proud to stand with Dreamers & I’ll keep fighting for a path to citizenship.

Better understanding health effects is precisely why I fought for PFAS funding in the infrastructure law & why I’ll work to extend authorization of the health study I established & improve PFAS cleanups as the Armed Services Committee gets to work on the annual NDAA this week.

These new health advisories are an early step in a critical process to develop national drinking water standards for several types of PFAS. Understanding the full scope of the health effects from exposure is critical to keeping people safe.

Reservists & Guard members deserve the same burial rights in state veterans cemeteries as active component service members. For too long that wasn’t the case. Now that my bill is law, our nation has finally been able to right that wrong. 

https://t.co/qADankvH61

Great to see A/S Donfried visiting Azerbaijan, Georgia & Armenia to recognize the 30th anniversary of diplomatic relations w/ the U.S. 

Her visit is a powerful message of U.S. support for these nations & commitment to peace and democracy in the region.

🚨 🚨 More than $6M is heading to NH communities for drinking water and wastewater improvements!  

A year later and the American Rescue Plan is still delivering for NH families. Appreciate @POTUS & all the Democrats who worked to make this bill a reality.

I am closely following the UK govt’s decision to consider legislation on the Northern Ireland Protocol. I encourage the UK to work w/ the EU to continue pursuing a diplomatic solution & ensure that peace is maintained in Northern Ireland & the Good Friday Agreement is maintained.

On Flag Day, let us all take a moment to remember what this powerful symbol represents & never take for granted the liberties and freedoms our country stands for. And most critically – let us honor those who’ve served and sacrificed to defend it.

Last week, @SenatorMenendez sent a letter to @POTUS urging him to take additional measures to prioritize U.S. support for Ukrainian children w/ disabilities, who are particularly vulnerable amid Putin’s brutal & unprovoked war in Ukraine. 

Read it here ⬇️. https://t.co/kSQQ7Vo0O7
Happy birthday, @USArmy! Today we celebrate our nation’s first military branch and commemorate the 247 years of service and sacrifice made by American Soldiers to keep our country safe and free.

I led a letter to @ENERGY calling for updates to appliance efficiency standards to keep energy costs down for working families & reduce greenhouse gas emissions. 

Glad to see this proposal from the admin that will help build a more sustainable & prosperous future.

Rates of substance use remain alarmingly high in NH. Every action must be made to finally turn the tide on this devastating crisis – I’ll keep working to assist frontline responders and expand access to recovery & treatment programs, interdiction efforts & prevention policies.

Today I’ll vote to pass historic, bipartisan legislation to provide health care and benefits for all veterans suffering from toxic exposure. This overdue bill will better ensure all our veterans get the care they’ve earned & deserve.

This proposal represents meaningful progress to make our communities safer from gun violence. It also reaffirms that there is common ground in Congress as long as there are those willing to find it. 

Inaction Is not an option. The Senate must act swiftly to get this done.

The attack on the Capitol was not merely a riot – it was a violent insurrection based on dangerous, fraudulent claims.

These hearings are critical to uncovering what happened on that dark day to safeguard our democracy and prevent history from repeating itself.

ICYMI: My bipartisan bill w/ @SenatorRounds unanimously passed the Senate.

There is overwhelming bipartisan consensus around supporting our veterans & ensuring future generations learn about the legacy of WWII. Looking forward to House consideration soon. https://t.co/U1m702y2hV

I wrote the policy that established an ISIS Detainee Coordinator. Currently, the person in that job is also responsible for counterterrorism, a huge responsibility.

We need a coordinator that is solely focused on securing ISIS detainees & working for their repatriation. https://t.co/3EKXGDG70Z

My thoughts are with Captain Losapio’s family, friends and fellow Marines at this devastating time. This is a tragic loss for our military & every effort should be made to understand how this occurred so it never happens again. https://t.co/T4SKMrCMdc

Congrats to WFEA Radio for celebrating 90 years of broadcasting across NH! As NH’s longest continuously running radio station, your commitment to informing and connecting Granite State communities does not go unnoticed.

Nearly 60 years ago the #EqualPayAct was signed into law, yet working women – particularly women of color – continue to face persistent pay gaps at work. 

We need to make equal pay for equal work a reality. Congress needs to pass the Paycheck Fairness Act.

Servicewomen risk their lives to safeguard our liberty – what does it say about U.S. values if we maintain that expectation while stripping them of personal freedoms to make private health decisions? 

Proud to help lead this bill to protect abortion access for women in uniform.

Access to fresh, nutritious food is too often out of reach, particularly in underserved communities. That’s why I helped NH’s only food bank – @NHFB – work with the state to partner w/ @USDA to support local farmers & increase access to healthy food at NH pantries.

It was wonderful to have Experience New Hampshire back in DC for the first time since 2019! Thank you to our vendors & the New Hampshire State Society for continuing this honored tradition.  

It’s always a joy to help show Washington what makes the Granite State so special. https://t.co/nZYw9tmRkZ

Today I met Lily & Elise, who live w/ Type 1 diabetes & spoke with their parents about the financial challenges of T1D care.
 
@SenatorCollins & I are working to lower the cost of insulin for Lily, Elise & the millions who rely on this lifesaving medication. Let's get this done. https://t.co/3TU60ry6Ka

Proud to lead this bipartisan resolution with every woman of the Senate to send a powerful message that the United States stands firmly with the Ukrainian women who are fighting for their freedom & democratic values worldwide.
I couldn’t agree more! Thanks for stopping by, @SenatorTester.

The threat to Roe v. Wade & decades of precedent that has safeguarded women’s freedom & personal health decisions are real.

Every effort must be made to protect women’s rights & health. Glad to joint his effort w/ @PattyMurray & @SenWarren.

Today is #WorldOceansDay!

NH’s seacoast is one of the most treasured parts of our state, but the climate crisis has put too many of our coastal communities in jeopardy. 

We’ve all got to do our part & work together to build a cleaner, safer and more sustainable future.

Zip code should never determine students’ opportunities and access to higher education. That's why I'm thrilled to see $1.2M heading to White Mountains Community College & @Compactnh to provide rural students w/ tools for college readiness & career mobility.

Broadband is essential for our everyday lives – from students learning in schools & parents teleworking to small businesses managing operations.

I’m thrilled to see $50M from the American Rescue Plan heading to the Granite State to expand essential broadband infrastructure.

Millions of Americans have student loans. Payment pause extensions have been essential to borrowers during COVID, but the last-minute notice has hurt their ability to plan their finances. 

Today, I pushed @usedgov for clarity & communication for borrowers with student loans.

Thank you, @McConaughey, for using your platform to share the stories of the children killed in Uvalde & calling on Congress to address gun violence now.

Responsible gun ownership & meaningful reform are not mutually exclusive. We have a moral imperative to stop these massacres.

Birth control is essential health care – that’s why I’m fighting to expand access to affordable birth control for women across the country by requiring insurance companies to cover the cost. #AffordabilityIsAccess

🚨🚨 Marty & Kodak have safely arrived! 

Excited to have this dynamic duo in DC for Experience NH. https://t.co/JvgOZfrPe1

Soaring inflation is putting essential groceries out of reach for Granite State families. I appreciate food pantries like United Way of Greater Nashua holding food drives to help local food banks stay stocked & I’m working in Congress to combat inflation & help families stay fed.

I stand with Granite Staters mourning victims of gun violence whose lives were senselessly taken.  

Enough is enough. It’s time for lawmakers in Congress to match their words with policy & change and take action to make our communities safer.  

https://t.co/qQsgqSfScj

Millions rely on life-saving insulin, but costs are too high.

I'm co-leading a bipartisan effort to lower insulin costs & I want to hear from you: What does insulin mean to you? How are high insulin prices affecting you?

Submit stories to Insulinstories@shaheen.senate.gov.

Glad to see $2.6M from the @Interior's Land and Water Conservation Fund heading to NH! This funding will help revitalize our public lands and support outdoor recreation across the Granite State.  

https://t.co/rkEjwam2eO

NEW: Guard members & Reservists across NH can now be buried at the NH Veterans Cemetery, following bipartisan legislation I led that’s now law. All those who serve our nation deserve proper burial in veterans cemeteries – this is a meaningful change. 

https://t.co/LvKN6zARGv

Parents struggling to find formula to feed their babies need help now. 

@USDA just announced nationwide WIC waivers to increase access to formula amid this shortage. This is an important step, & I'll keep working w/ the admin to help families amid the formula crisis.

Journalists are keeping Ukrainians & the world informed by shedding light on atrocities committed by Russian forces.  

Today and every day, I stand with journalists around the world who put their lives on the line to report the truth & uphold an independent, free media.

Another weekend of devastating gun violence. More heartbreak & trauma. 

Philadelphia & Chattanooga join the long list of towns across the country grieving from massacres. 

Inaction is not an option. Congress must pass meaningful gun reform. 

https://t.co/l9DP7aDBJl

This @USGAO report confirms what many of us have long known: the Global Gag Rule has a lasting & devastating impact on the health of women & families in the most vulnerable communities around the globe. We need a permanent repeal of the Global Gag Rule now.https://t.co/lZxdShLKSl

Love is love. Wonderful to see Portsmouth kicking off #Pride!

https://t.co/MKx6PYkV6Z

The end of an era. 

Thank you again, @TomGriffithWMUR, for your years of service at @WMUR. We’ll miss seeing you on our TV screens, but wishing you the best in a well-deserved retirement. Congrats on an impeccable career.

It’s no mystery what policies can do to reduce gun violence. We can:  

🗸 Close loopholes to keep guns out of the wrong hands 
🗸 Strengthen background checks 
🗸 Crack down on automatic assault rifles 

Congress has the power to make these reforms – let’s get it done.

Too many lives lost. Too many families torn apart.  

It’s time to turn thoughts & prayers into action. #NationalGunViolenceAwarenessDay

25 years ago today, I signed bipartisan legislation to repeal the only law on the books that made abortion a felony in NH.  

I remember the realities women faced before Roe – We won’t go back.

George “Doc” Riordan was killed in action while serving as a medic in Vietnam. I’ve worked with his family for years to recognize his heroism through a Bronze Star. Today’s ceremony was a momentous occasion to posthumously award him this medal in honor of his service & sacrifice. https://t.co/gcaZubofIZ
Happy 603 Day, Granite Staters! #IYKYK
Commonsense gun reform and upholding the 2nd amendment are not mutually exclusive. Our people - our children - deserve better. They deserve action from Congress now.
Best of luck to the @Celtics in Game 1 of the NBA Finals tonight. Go get Banner 18!

I stopped by CCFHS' Response crisis center in Berlin to discuss support for survivors of domestic & sexual violence. I met with local advocates to hear how Congress can support their life-saving work to help survivors find safety, navigate the legal system & heal. https://t.co/xX3ExsC60D

Buffalo. Uvalde. Tulsa. Las Vegas. Orlando. Newtown. Parkland. Aurora. Columbine. 

The list goes on.  

How can anyone be complacent with this status quo? Refusing to enact common-sense gun reforms is cowardly, irresponsible and deadly.  

https://t.co/O8fihYygaD

I was in Conway today to review important infrastructure updates coming to the Mt. Washington Valley Technology Village Business Resource Center. I helped secure $200,000 to help the center grow & drive local economic growth, which will attract new residents & support local jobs. https://t.co/8z2azJkCk9

NEW: NH is receiving more than $4M to support @AmeriCorps programs to invest in STEM education, support survivors of domestic violence & prioritize environmental conservation. TY to all the volunteers who serve our communities & make these efforts possible.https://t.co/diRTWmEcDK

Devastated for the loved ones of those killed in Tulsa & the community that now joins a list of many terrorized by gun violence. 

Congress has a moral imperative to stop these senseless massacres – we urgently need common-sense gun reforms.

Looking to lower your broadband costs? You could be eligible for up to a $30 monthly discount on internet services through the Affordable Connectivity Program. 

I helped bolster this program as a lead negotiator of broadband provisions through the IIJA.
https://t.co/sFPEfVjLii

Proud to work with @senrobportman to get this building codes provision through Congress & signed into law. 

Glad to see @POTUS implement it to address inflation & climate change, reaffirming why energy efficiency is the sustainable solution we need in a 21st century economy.

Today, I visited the Little Antlers Learning Center in Plymouth to discuss childcare & early education needs. I toured renovations made possible through $200K I worked to secure – I’m excited for the new center to better meet the needs of families in Grafton County. https://t.co/XxShrcTe2i

Did you hear that? It was the sound of a glass ceiling shattering! 

Congrats Admiral Fagan and thank you for showing women & girls of all ages how to “lead from the front.” 

https://t.co/UCk9nwezWS

Check out these views! I was thrilled to ride on Mount Washington Cruise’s newest vessel, the Winnipesaukee Spirit, today as I met with local leaders to discuss the upcoming tourism season. https://t.co/R8Fz1l2tj8
Don’t forget Lebanon…or Concord or Coos County or…

Happy #Pride!

I'm proud to stand with LGBTQ+ communities in NH & around the world in the continued fight for equality for all – starting with Congress passing the Equality Act. 

LGBTQ+ rights are human rights. https://t.co/aNPytHY89I

I’m touched to see Afghan refugees being welcomed & finding homes in NH after fighting shoulder-to-shoulder with U.S. soldiers against the Taliban. I’m grateful for resettlement agencies on the ground helping Afghans find housing & jobs.  

 https://t.co/mUnbWEzThG

Mental illness is not unique to the U.S., but the devastating rate of gun violence is.  

It's time to focus on the heart of the issue – Congress must take action on meaningful gun reform to save lives. 

https://t.co/SNVxbVituO

NH is a top destination for visitors, and it’s great to see the tourism season kicked off with a strong start this weekend! Our booming tourism industry supports small businesses & job creation across the state. 

https://t.co/9wcoMy7dD0
I applaud the EU for enacting the biggest blow yet to the Kremlin’s cashflow. The U.S. stands in lockstep w/ our European partners to reduce Europe’s energy dependence on Russia.

Inflation is one of the top concerns I hear from Granite Staters. @POTUS is rightly focused on attacking high costs – I'm committed to working with the admin & fellow lawmakers to lower costs for working families. 

https://t.co/rZ9dpg2GeH
Every day, we should remember those who fought & died defending our liberty so that we may never take for granted the freedoms we enjoy.
I was honored to be at the NH Veterans Cemetery in Boscawen with @SecVetAffairs today to pay tribute to our fallen heroes & military families on Memorial Day. https://t.co/3NWsUJgz2J

Congrats to Shannon Wydra for receiving the Novice Educator of the Year award from the NH Science Teachers’ Association! Incredible to see the impact you’ve already had on your students & field – thank you for setting an example for educators across NH.  

https://t.co/R7QfYgaMw5

NH’s outdoor spaces are a treasure enjoyed by Granite Staters & have always been a staple in our tourism economy. 

I’ll continue to support programs like the LWCF to preserve public lands in NH, & I’m glad to join this bipartisan res commemorating June as Great Outdoors Month! https://t.co/pueC4XC0s8

Kudos to Eliana and Samantha Dominguez for creating a Multicultural Student Union at the Derryfield School. This effort emphasizes the importance of providing students of color with a safe space to embrace culture & find community. 

https://t.co/rRWxdZhYFx

Glad to support this bipartisan resolution condemning Putin for the unjust detention of Vladimir Kara-Murza & calling for his swift release. Putin’s imprisonment of the opposition underscores his fear of democracy and dissent. He must be held accountable. https://t.co/XpisK4DeJo

22 terms & 4 decades of service in the NH House – what a milestone. Thank you, Rep. Laura Pantelakos for the indelible impact you’ve left on the Granite State – your contributions will be felt for generations to come.

Students should never fear for their safety in the classroom. It’s heartbreaking to hear these Granite State students react to this week’s school massacre – this cannot be our status quo.

Congress can and must take action to stop these senseless deaths.
https://t.co/SvoQPTrvnm

I remember what it was like to be a mom with children on formula – for parents still scrambling to feed their babies, @NHDHHSPIO is helping NH families find formula.  

More info on resources available for Granite State parents here: 

https://t.co/XvBRQLgcc6

Excited to see $8.6M in federal dollars heading to key NH projects. As a senior member of the Appropriations Committee, ensuring the Corps has the resources it needs every year to prioritize local projects is always a top concern.
I’m wondering the same thing, @RepAnnieKuster.

The GOP response rings hollow as long as these same lawmakers refuse to consider common-sense reform that will reduce gun violence & help keep communities safe. 

Enough is enough.

Just as the international community has rallied around welcoming Ukrainian refugees, a pathway to safety should be provided to Afghans fleeing the Taliban’s danger. I’m joining a letter w/ @SenMarkey to ensure a level playing field for Afghans applying for humanitarian parole. https://t.co/OeIKLgTnGG

What does it say about the GOP that they won’t even engage on a common-sense bill to address domestic terrorism? 

This is about keeping communities safe. The political grandstanding is making our country less secure – it has got to stop.
https://t.co/DOcAUO52pp

Proud to have helped launch the 988 Lifeline.  

Starting in July, Granite Staters experiencing a mental health crisis can dial 9-8-8 and get access to the help they need.
We need more than thoughts & prayers to stop gun violence: we need policy and action.

"Schoolchildren. Teachers. Executed on their own campus. Murdered in the place where they should be safe, where they should be growing and becoming. 

"As a nation, we lack the capacity to seriously grapple with gun violence.” 

We cannot accept this status quo.

More than 200 mass shootings in 2022, and it’s only May. We’ve seen more mass shootings than days in the year. 

Inaction is not an option. Our children and communities living in fear deserve better.

In the wake of the Uvalde massacre, today I chaired a hearing w/ @FBI Director Wray. Congress must work with the FBI to stem gun violence & domestic terrorism.  

My opening remarks below: https://t.co/nVSRhgAC1T

For the families who woke up with dread in their hearts & who will never feel whole again, I won't give up on sensible gun reform. 

@GOP – come to the table and work with us to end these massacres.

.@POTUS is right: it is time to turn pain into action. Our families deserve better than leaders more beholden to the gun lobby than to protecting our kids. Congress must not accept or be complicit with allowing this gun violence to go on. We need common sense gun reform now.

I can't find the words for the horror and pain affected families must be experiencing. My thoughts are with them and the Uvalde community. The mass shootings status quo in America cannot stand. We need common sense gun laws now.

I’m leading a bipartisan letter w/ @SenThomTillis & 80 Senators urging @POTUS to expedite Sweden & Finland’s applications to join NATO.

Expanding membership will bolster NATO’s military & diplomatic capabilities as Russia threatens global security amid its invasion of Ukraine.

Housing insecurity is one of the most pressing challenges facing veterans. Expanding access to affordable, secure housing has always been a top priority of mine, & I’ll keep working with frontline orgs like Harbor Care to make sure our veterans have the support they need.

Testing is an important step you can take to protect yourself and others as NH sees another surge in COVID cases. 

U.S. residents can still order 8 free at-home testing kits! Visit https://t.co/khWt2IQzZM to get yours.

I’ve proudly been on this list since 2017. Glad to be in such good – and growing – company.  

https://t.co/RzomTM2frC
🚨 $18.6M is heading to NH to update aging water systems! I helped secure this $$ in the FY22 government funding bill because every Granite State family deserves safe & reliable drinking water.

Tens of thousands of families across NH & New England are hurting w/ shortages around formula. Time is of the essence – I’m leading a letter to Abbott’s CEO urging relief around burdensome contracts to ensure access in our region. More here: https://t.co/g49sku501D

I wrote an op-ed in the @UnionLeader about what’s at stake for women’s freedoms in NH if Roe is overturned.

Women deserve full autonomy on decisions around their bodies & starting families – we must fight against this dangerous anti-women agenda.
https://t.co/UAnoPFi63D

As co-chair of the Senate NATO Observer Group, I’m proud of the continued bipartisan work in Congress to bolster the Alliance, including this new res in support of Finland & Sweden’s accession into NATO. I urge lawmakers to ratify their accession & for NATO Allies to do the same. https://t.co/SD52daIsIG

The bipartisan infrastructure law invests in the transition to clean, low- & zero-emission school buses, which will improve the health & safety for our communities. School districts & other eligible operators can now apply. More info ⬇️
https://t.co/QtlNTHYfju

NH Families visit @HHSGov for resources to locate infant formula. Please follow public health guidance and contact your child’s health care provider for feeding recommendations, as homemade formula and other alternatives can have dangerous consequences.

Congrats to Lebanon’s Angela Zhang for being named social worker of the year by the NH chapter of @NASW. The Granite State is grateful for your commitment to advocating for families with limited access to resources & services across the Upper Valley. 

https://t.co/KP6fbDJ5Fv

I was honored to join the 30th Annual New Hampshire Fallen Law Enforcement Officers Memorial Ceremony in Concord today. This ceremony pays tribute to Granite Staters who’ve bravely fought to defend our country, including those who made the ultimate sacrifice.

Thanks, @DrGupta46, for stopping by NH to discuss expanding access to life-saving substance use prevention & treatment programs. I appreciate @ONDCP’s partnership to turn the tide on this devastating crisis, especially as we come out of the pandemic. https://t.co/y2nrysrAi7
Wishing my dear friend @RepAnnieKuster a speedy recovery.

May is National #DrugCourtMonth. Drug Court programs help combat the substance use disorder crisis by expanding access to life-saving treatment programs.

We can’t jail our way out of this public health crisis, which is why I’ve proudly helped secure $$ to support these programs.
Putin has a delusional agenda to reconstitute a Russian empire, and the U.S. must support countries like Moldova. To our partners in Moldova heroically responding to aid their neighbors: thank you.🇲🇩

Moldova is punching above its weight in response to Putin’s invasion of Ukraine, accepting 100k refugees, or 16% of its population. In recognition of their inspiring response, I’m proud to join a res encouraging @SecBlinken to provide them aid for their efforts. https://t.co/zLHiUmAx3Q

The formula shortage crisis is hitting working families hard with each day that passes.

We need a federal coordinator in place to address production bottlenecks & prevent future contamination of baby formula – glad to join this effort w/ @PattyMurray and @SenBobCasey. https://t.co/FAUMRQWKox
I asked @SecGranholm how the admin is addressing these national security & energy threats, as we work toward new tech & clean energy solutions for the future.
Putin’s unprovoked war in Ukraine underscores the urgent need for the U.S. to work with our European allies to secure energy independence from Russian oil & gas. https://t.co/H63lqwqHZh

After three months, the U.S Embassy in Kyiv has reopened – an important signal of Ukraine’s progress in defending its territory & the United States’ unwavering support for its mission.

Great to see the U.S. flag flying over the embassy once again.

https://t.co/PZ2vQNGuhZ

The Senate unanimously passed bipartisan legislation to increase access to baby formula amid serious shortages. 

I’m proud to cosponsor this bill to help millions of families on WIC get the nutrition they need for their children. Looking forward to @POTUS signing this into law.

Yesterday I met with Kosovo’s PM, @albinkurti, w/ @SenThomTillis. Kosovo’s relations with the U.S. are strong and they are an important ally in rebuffing Putin’s campaign of malign influence across the Balkans region. Proud to support Kosovo and their Euro-Atlantic aspirations. https://t.co/gpB7Mn8pvd

Restaurants & small businesses are still reeling from the economic impacts of COVID – assistance is needed to help them stay afloat.

Disappointed the Senate wouldn’t act today to support these local institutions that create jobs & drive local economic growth.

This emergency military & humanitarian aid is long overdue & will make a real difference for millions of Ukrainians under siege. The U.S. must continue to stand w/ Ukraine in the fight to defend its sovereignty & democracy around world. 

https://t.co/XuLabJCu0I

NEW: Over $28M is heading to NH to combat the substance use disorder crisis. For years, State Opioid Response grants have helped deliver treatment to Granite Staters in need, which is why I pushed against funding cliffs for NH. More here: https://t.co/Dr3VgZ859p

This is only a snapshot of what this law means for NH. Granite Staters will soon see the impacts of this law in their neighborhoods and on their way to work, which is precisely what delivering this legislation was all about.

🚰 Over $72M for water infrastructure improvements to support safe drinking water & combat PFAS contamination 

🛣️ $218M for our highways & $45M for repairs to red-list bridges  

🚌 $24M to bolster public transportation systems

Secretary Albright was a little girl who came to the United States as a refugee fleeing Hitler’s terror who rose to become the face of U.S. diplomacy and foreign policy. Her life epitomizes the American Dream and she never let anyone lose sight of that.
Her empathy and understanding guided her leadership of the State Department and our country is better for it. My thoughts are with her family, friends and all those in mourning.

Madeleine Albright shattered the glass ceiling at the State Department when she was sworn in as the first female Secretary of State. In the years since, we have seen women follow in her footsteps and stand on her shoulders as public servants, diplomats, and yes – U.S. Senators.
As the only woman on the Senate Foreign Relations Committee, I leaned on her for advice and guidance over the years – words of wisdom that I’ll always treasure.
We were linked through our common bonds as women working in national security structures, which before her were almost entirely off limits to women.
I’m honored to have had the opportunity to not only engage with Secretary Albright in my capacity as a lawmaker, but to have enjoyed her company personally.

My heart is heavy as I join all Americans in mourning the loss of Madeleine Albright. Her triumph and success as a diplomat, public servant and fervent defender of democracy enshrined her legacy in U.S. history long ago. We have lost a giant and I have lost a dear friend.
